abstract: British Justice Michael Supperstone rules in favor of six Lithuanian migrant workers who claim they were lured to Great Britain under false promises of employment but instead endured squalid conditions and sub-minimal wages working as chicken catchers for D J Houghton Catching Services; case has been closely watched following passage in 2015 of Modern Slavery Act.

headline.print_headline: Judge Orders Proper Pay for Migrants in Britain
headline.main: British Judge Orders Proper Pay for Exploited Migrant Workers

snippet: The Lithuanian workers, who caught chickens, were not paid minimum wage and were charged illegal fees, and their wages were improperly withheld.
lead_paragraph: The Lithuanian workers, who caught chickens, were not paid minimum wage and were charged illegal fees, and their wages were improperly withheld.
